title: Japanese stocks rebound after global sell-off; U.S. futures edge up
content: Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 index ended the day up 10.23 percent on Tuesday, after its biggest single-day point drop Monday. Other Asian indices rebounded.
summary: Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 index ended the day up 10.23 percent on Tuesday, after its biggest single-day point drop Monday. Other Asian indices rebounded.

title: Bangladesh dissolves Parliament; protesters call for Nobel laureate to lead
content: The student protesters behind the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina rejected army rule and backed Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus to head the interim government.
summary: The student protesters behind the ouster of Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina rejected army rule and backed Peace Prize winner Muhammad Yunus to head the interim government.

title: Why has the Japanese stock market been on a roller coaster ride?
content: Record fall one day, record rise the next. The Japanese stock market is gyrating in part because the country’s currency has been weakening — until last month.
summary: Record fall one day, record rise the next. The Japanese stock market is gyrating in part because the country’s currency has been weakening — until last month.

title: TikTok to remove feature for some users after E.U. says it’s addictive
content: TikTok Lite is removing a rewards program in E.U. countries after regulators accused the company of creating addictive features that could harm children.
summary: TikTok Lite is removing a rewards program in E.U. countries after regulators accused the company of creating addictive features that could harm children.

title: Bangladesh’s Hasina faces the revenge of history
content: What comes next in Bangladesh is far from certain. The specter of further political violence is real.
summary: What comes next in Bangladesh is far from certain. The specter of further political violence is real.

title: U.S. says several troops hurt in Iraq attack
content: U.S. troops at Al Assad air base in Iraq were wounded in a rocket attack Monday, the Pentagon said.
summary: U.S. troops at Al Assad air base in Iraq were wounded in a rocket attack Monday, the Pentagon said.

title: U.N. fires Gaza staff, citing possible involvement in attack on Israel
content: The U.N. fired nine employees of UNRWA, a key relief agency in Gaza, after determining they “may have been involved” in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.
summary: The U.N. fired nine employees of UNRWA, a key relief agency in Gaza, after determining they “may have been involved” in the Oct. 7 Hamas-led attack on Israel.

title: Houthi drone expert among those killed in U.S. strike in Iraq
content: A Houthi commander’s death in Iraq illustrates the cooperation among Iran-backed groups in the Middle East as the region faces the threat of worsening violence.
summary: A Houthi commander’s death in Iraq illustrates the cooperation among Iran-backed groups in the Middle East as the region faces the threat of worsening violence.

title: Israel on alert for retaliation; U.S. officials say attack may be imminent
content: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu discussed preparations for counterstrikes with his security cabinet. Hamas and Iran blame Israel for the killing of a Hamas leader.
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu discussed preparations for counterstrikes with his security cabinet. Hamas and Iran blame Israel for the killing of a Hamas leader.

title: Mali cuts ties with Ukraine, claiming Kyiv’s involvement in rebel attacks
content: Kyiv said Mali failed to provide evidence of any Ukrainian involvement in the attacks by Tuareg rebels in northern Mali that killed Russian and Malian troops.
summary: Kyiv said Mali failed to provide evidence of any Ukrainian involvement in the attacks by Tuareg rebels in northern Mali that killed Russian and Malian troops.

title: Maduro perdió las elecciones según actas recopiladas por la oposición
content: Edmundo González habría vencido al presidente Nicolás Maduro el 28 de julio por millones de votos, según muestra un análisis de datos de las actas electorales.
summary: Edmundo González habría vencido al presidente Nicolás Maduro el 28 de julio por millones de votos, según muestra un análisis de datos de las actas electorales.

title: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigns and flees country
content: Hasina’s resignation, announced by Gen. Waker-Uz-Zaman, comes after hundreds have been killed in clashes between protesters and security forces in recent weeks.
summary: Hasina’s resignation, announced by Gen. Waker-Uz-Zaman, comes after hundreds have been killed in clashes between protesters and security forces in recent weeks.

title: How the U.S. military cultivated — and then lost — a key African ally
content: A timeline of key events in the lead-up to the U.S. troop withdrawal on Monday from the West African country of Niger.
summary: A timeline of key events in the lead-up to the U.S. troop withdrawal on Monday from the West African country of Niger.

title: U.S. troops withdraw from strategic West African base as militant threat grows
content: The U.S. military pullout from the sprawling Agadez base in Niger deals a setback to efforts at countering Islamist insurgents and resisting Russian influence.
summary: The U.S. military pullout from the sprawling Agadez base in Niger deals a setback to efforts at countering Islamist insurgents and resisting Russian influence.

title: Who is Sheikh Hasina, Bangladeshi leader who fled protests?
content: Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh’s prime minister following deadly protests, fleeing to India on Monday.
summary: Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh’s prime minister following deadly protests, fleeing to India on Monday.

title: Taiwan celebrates Olympic gold (and China tries to ignore it)
content: This came after repeated cheers for “Taiwan” — officially “Chinese Taipei” at the Olympics — and an incident in which a sign was snatched at the Paris Games.
summary: This came after repeated cheers for “Taiwan” — officially “Chinese Taipei” at the Olympics — and an incident in which a sign was snatched at the Paris Games.

title: In photos: The scene in Bangladesh after clashes between protesters, security forces
content: Weeks of violence between Bangladeshi security forces and anti-government demonstrators intensified this weekend.
summary: Weeks of violence between Bangladeshi security forces and anti-government demonstrators intensified this weekend.

title: Thailand may soon take another backward step
content: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court may rule to effectively disqualify Pita Limjaroenrat — arguably the country’s most popular politician — from holding office in the near future.
summary: On Aug. 7, Thailand’s constitutional court may rule to effectively disqualify Pita Limjaroenrat — arguably the country’s most popular politician — from holding office in the near future.

title: Maduro lost election, tallies collected by Venezuela’s opposition show
content: Edmundo González likely beat President Nicolás Maduro in the July 28 election by millions of votes, a review of data from election receipts shows.
summary: Edmundo González likely beat President Nicolás Maduro in the July 28 election by millions of votes, a review of data from election receipts shows.

title: First F-16 fighter jets have arrived in Ukraine, Zelensky confirms
content: The planes are unlikely to fly near the front lines, officials said, as there are too few of them — and too many Russian defense systems that can shoot them down.
summary: The planes are unlikely to fly near the front lines, officials said, as there are too few of them — and too many Russian defense systems that can shoot them down.

title: Far-right protesters attack hotel housing asylum seekers in violent weekend
content: Demonstrations in Rotherham, Liverpool, Hull and Bristol turned violent, prompting arrests. Misinformation about a deadly knife attack in Southport, England, spurred far-right protests.
summary: Demonstrations in Rotherham, Liverpool, Hull and Bristol turned violent, prompting arrests. Misinformation about a deadly knife attack in Southport, England, spurred far-right protests.

title: Dozens killed as anti-government protests resume in Bangladesh
content: A nationwide curfew was imposed in Bangladesh as fresh protests in the country turned violent.
summary: A nationwide curfew was imposed in Bangladesh as fresh protests in the country turned violent.

title: Strikes in Gaza, stabbing near Tel Aviv amid fears of wider Mideast war
content: At least 30 people were killed in Israeli strikes at schools housing displaced people, Gazan authorities said. The IDF said the schools were used by Hamas.
summary: At least 30 people were killed in Israeli strikes at schools housing displaced people, Gazan authorities said. The IDF said the schools were used by Hamas.
